channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16649] Truncate table with splits preserved can cause both data loss and truncated data appeared again
item.description:
Since truncate table with splits preserved will delete hfiles and use the previous regioninfo. It can cause odd behaviors

  • Case 1: Data appeared after truncate
    reproduce procedure：
    1. create a table, let's say 'test'
    2. write data to 'test', make sure memstore of 'test' is not empty
    3. truncate 'test' with splits preserved
    4. kill the regionserver hosting the region(s) of 'test'
    5. start the regionserver, now it is the time to witness the miracle! the truncated data appeared in table 'test'
  • Case 2: Data loss
    reproduce procedure:
    1. create a table, let's say 'test'
    2. write some data to 'test', no matter how many
    3. truncate 'test' with splits preserved
    4. restart the regionserver to reset the seqid
    5. write some data, but less than 2 since we don't want the seqid to run over the one in 2
    6. kill the regionserver hosting the region(s) of 'test'
    7. restart the regionserver. Congratulations! the data writen in 4 is now all lost

Why?
for case 1
Since preserve splits in truncate table procedure will not change the regioninfo, when log replay happens, the 'unflushed' data will restore back to the region
for case 2
since the flushedSequenceIdByRegion are stored in Master in a map with the region's encodedName. Although the table is truncated, the region's name is not changed since we chose to preserve the splits. So after truncate the table, the region's sequenceid is reset in the regionserver, but not reset in master. When flush comes and report to master, master will reject the update of sequenceid since the new one is smaller than the old one. The same happens in log replay, all the edits writen in 4 will be skipped since they have a smaller seqid
item.summary: Truncate table with splits preserved can cause both data loss and truncated data appeared again

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
For #2, the region's sequenceid's should be reset in master.

Do you want to attach patch ?

Thanks
I have another thought, can we change the region's encoded name even if we want to preserve the splits? Creating whole new regions after truncating may solve the two cases, I think.
That would be slower compared to the current implementation (with bugs fixed) since layout on hdfs would be touched.

current implementation we drop the fs dirs, and recreate them.
we can just regenerate the regionInfo, so they will get a new encodedName

not sure why we have always ignored the server manager containing region info, but that will also be a good thing to throw away on region remove. not just as fix for this. I think creating new name for truncate will result easier for debug.

attached a v0 draft that does both
Your patch is exactly what I want to do!
Shouldn't data structures involving the obsolete region info be cleaned in master ?

what do you mean? I'm not sure to understand the above.

In the patch above, we are removing the deleted regions from ServerManager.
in HMaster we have at least two places I know of where we have region states. The AM and the ServerManager.
the attached patch, adds the removal of the ServerManager stuff when delete/truncate table is called and when the CatalogJanitor is removing the region from split/merge (those should be the only places where we remove regions). and these calls happen on the HMaster.
When is the obsolete region taken off storeFlushedSequenceIdsByRegion ?

Another thing is that we should change the seqid in master even if the new one is smaller than the old one, better have some redundant data when replay than lose them, right?


if (existingValue == null || (l != HConstants.NO_SEQNUM && l > existingValue)) {

        flushedSequenceIdByRegion.put(encodedRegionName, l);

      } else if (l != HConstants.NO_SEQNUM && l < existingValue) {

        flushedSequenceIdByRegion.put(encodedRegionName, l);  //update the seqid but log a warning

        LOG.warn("RegionServer " + sn + " indicates a last flushed sequence id ("

            + l + ") that is less than the previous last flushed sequence id ("

            + existingValue + ") for region " + Bytes.toString(entry.getKey()) + " Ignoring.");

      }
table delete, table truncate, catalog janitor when removing merged region and split parent
let's open another jira to discuss this. since it seems a bit more involved and it is not related directly to DDLs.

-1 overall

Agreed that it is the safest approach to re-create the regions with different encoded names.

private static List<HRegionInfo> recreteRegionInfo(final List<HRegionInfo> regions) {

Typo? recreate?
Theoretically this should not happen? I mean a smaller flush sequence id. And remove this can not solve all the problems as you may do log replay before the new sequence id reported.

I mean add the line 'flushedSequenceIdByRegion.put(encodedRegionName, l);' In trunk, when smaller seq id is reported, it will be ignored.
My point is that is no harm to update the seqid even if it is smaller. Otherwise, if this situation do happen, data loss it is a sure thing.

+1. V2 looks good to me. (The only thing I am unsure is that whether we catch all cases here. For truncate table, the patch would fix the corruption.)

I think this change should go to all branches (include non-proc-V2 based branch such as 0.98 and 1.0).
